meanings.definition: To throb more intensely or strongly than something else.
meanings.sent1: The music was outthrobbing my heartbeat.
meanings.sent2: Her excitement was outthrobbing her fear.
meanings.sent3: The drum was outthrobbing the rain outside.
meanings.sent4: His passion for the game outthrobbed his exhaustion.
meanings.sent5: The engine's roar outthrobbed the surrounding noise.

meanings.definition: The action of throbbing more intensely or strongly than something else.
meanings.sent1: The outthrobbing of the bass could be felt in our chests.
meanings.sent2: The outthrobbing of the headache made it hard to focus.
meanings.sent3: The outthrobbing of the engine drowned out all other sounds.
meanings.sent4: The outthrobbing of the storm matched the rhythm of her heart.
meanings.sent5: The outthrobbing of the drums set the pace for the entire performance.
